desc_program:
This record summarizes holiday season donation and sponsorship programs, community meals which provide an opportunity for all members of the public to enjoy a Christmas meal with others (all are free of charge), and volunteering opportunities.

NOTE: This list is updated as information becomes available.

VOLUNTEERING

Volunteer Halton has volunteering opportunities for a wide range of local nonprofit organizations.

GET HELP: Free Community Dinners

Provides an opportunity for the public to enjoy a Christmas meal with others.
* the following dates are for a traditional Christmas meal
* all are free, and open to the public
* donations accepted

Milton Area Christian Churches Working Together, Christmas Dinner
Where: St. Paul's United Church Community Room, 123 Main Street, Milton
When: Monday, December 17, 2018 5 pm-7 pm (By invitation)
Traditional Christmas meal with turkey, stuffing, mashed potatoes, gravy, vegetables, salad and dessert
Contact: Please contact 905-691-3734 or 905-876-3544 to request an invitation

The House of David, Christmas Dinner
Where: Milton Art Center, 1010 Main Street, Milton
When: Sunday, December 16, 2018 5 pm
Contact: Call 647-999-3562 for details

Grace Anglican Church, Community Dinner
Where: 317 Main Street
When: Thu Dec 6, 2018 5 pm-6:30 pm
No cost, but free will offerings accepted
Contact: 905-878-2411

Grace Anglican Church, Turkey Dinner
Where: 317 Main Street
When: Sunday, Dec 16, 2018 5 pm-7 pm
Contact: 905-878-2411

St Georges Anglican Church, Mistletoe Bazaar
Where: 7051 Guelph Line, Campbellville
When: Saturday, November 17, 2018
Contact: Call 905-878-1112 for details

GIVE HELP: Food, Gift and Toy Drives

Halton Regional Police Service, Toys for Tots
Donations of new unwrapped toys to any Halton Regional Police station.
Where: Drop off at any police station
When: Until Wed Dec 19, 2018
Contact: ToysForTots@haltonpolice.ca

Toys for the North, Royal Canadian Mounted Police
Donations of new unwrapped toys at our Milton Detachment during regular business hours.
Where: Royal Canadian Mounted Police, Milton - Toronto West Detachment, 2755 High Point Dr, Milton, ON L9T 5E8
When: Donation boxes will be available between Monday, November 5, 2018 and Monday, November 23, 2018, 9 am – 3:30 pm.
Contact: Corporal Louise Savard, RCMP Media Relations, 905-876-97091

Miracle on Main Street!, Tigerjeet Singh Foundation
* Bring a new unwrapped toy to help brighten a child's holiday
* The Miracle on Main Street is a free event with food, drinks, entertainment, rides and more
Where: Troy's Diner, 295 Main Street, Milton
When: Mon Dec 10, 2018 6:30 am-9:30 am

Halton Regional Police Service, Stockings for Seniors
Donation of small "Christmas stocking" size gifts to give to Seniors residing in Long Term Care facilities on Christmas morning. Items being collected for both men and women include; Shampoo,Body wash (unscented)' Body lotion (unscented), Deodorant, Non-slip socks/slippers, Night gown/pajamas, Diabetic candies, Nail polish, Chocolates
Where: Drop off at Halton Regional Police Service station in Milton located at 490 Childs Drive, Milton
When: Until Friday December 21, 2018
Contact: Constable Sarah McCullagh, 905-825-4747 ext. 2419

The Annual Milton Community Food Drive presented by The Salvation Army and the Milton Fire Department
* Goal: 25,000 lbs of food in five hours in order to provide for The Salvation Army's Christmas Hampers, as well as restocking the food bank for the next year
* Items required are non perishable foods (check expiry dates), household cleaning products, toiletries, baby Items
When: Sat Dec 1, 2018 10 am-12 pm
Where: Loblaws Superstore, Walmart, Metro, Food Basics, La Rose Italian Bakery, The Food Port, No Frills, Canadian Tire, Sobeys
* Toy donations can be dropped off during November and December at The Salvation Army Khi Community 820 Nipissing Rd.unit 4
* Monetary donations may be made at the Christmas Kettles located at: Metro, Walmart, Superstore, LCBO, The Milton Mall, or La Rosa Bakery (Saturday a.m. only)

Halton Learning Foundation: No Student Left Behind
For more information call 905-335-3665, ext 3408 or email info@haltonlearningfoundation.ca

Contact: To arrange an alternative drop off time call 905-462-1305

Halton Region Shoebox Project for Shelters
For more information on the Shoebox Project contact Emma Crane via email at halton@shoeboxproject.com
* Collects small gifts packaged in decorated shoeboxes for distribution to women in local shelters and others in need.
* Items can include jewelry, makeup, hair accessories, scarves, hats, gloves, gift cards (include the value and receipt if possible) as well as personal products (no candles, products containing alcohol, razors, Halloween candy, books or clothes that are sized).
* Boxes must be unsealed and items must be unused and packaged and kept to a value of $50
* Check website for details here

Friendship Shoebox Campaign by 'I Love First Peoples'
For more information about the campaign and drop-off locations contact Anna Cansick, milton.ilfp@gmail.com. 905.875.7765
* Collects quality gifts suitable for a boy or girl (themes like arts & crafts, nature & gardening, science, sports, writing & literature,etc) packaged in Shoeboxes for distribution to First nation children across Canada
* Running from November 1 to December 15
* Drop-off locations: ZAK's Pharmacy 70 Main Street East, Apple Dental Milton 450 Bronte Street South, Suites 207-209, Milton Public Library-Main location 1010 Main Street and Beaty Branch location 945 Fourth Line (905-875-2665)

category: Food banks;Food Hampers;Free / Low Cost Meals;Free / Low-cost meals;Test - Food Banks;Volunteer Opportunities
desc_program:
This record summarizes holiday season donation and sponsorship programs, community meals which provide an opportunity for all members of the public to enjoy a Christmas meal with others (all are free of charge), and volunteering opportunities.

Volunteering

Volunteer Halton has volunteering opportunities for a wide range of local nonprofit organizations.

Christmas Assistance, Food and Toy Hampers

Acton Christmas Hamper Committee
Those struggling to meet family needs this Christmas season can apply to receive a food and toy hamper.
Where: Apply at The Salvation Army Community Church, 114 Mill St E, Acton. Applications must be completed in person. Bring current (not expired) identification for all family members as well as current proof of residency. Applications cannot be taken unless these are provided.
When: Application dates are:
Tue, Nov. 6th and Wed, Nov. 7th, 10 am-12 noon
Tue, Nov. 13th and Wed, Nov. 14th, 1-3 pm
Tue, Nov. 20th and Wed, Nov. 21st, 10 am-12 noon
Tue, Nov. 27th and Wed, Nov. 28th, 1-3 pm
Nov 28 is the final deadline for applications.
Food hampers will be distributed on Sat, Dec. 15th at St. Joseph Patron of Canada Church, 64 Church St E, Acton.

Links2Care Holiday Giving Program
Families and individuals in need can apply to receive gifts of pajamas, socks, underwear and toiletries for children up to 16 years of age from eligible low income families in Halton Hills.
Where: Applications are available online or by contacting Links2Care. Proof of income is required.
When: Deadline for application is Dec. 7th
Contact: Cathy or Janet at 519-853-3310

The Salvation Army Georgetown Community Church
Applications for Christmas assistance. Applicants must bring identification for themselves and anyone else being named on the application (including children), proof of rent and proof of income.
Where: Georgetown Community Church, 271 Mountainview Rd S, Georgetown
When: Wed-Fri, Nov. 14th to Dec. 13th, 10 am-12 noon
Contact: 905-877-1374 ext. 101 for more information
Donations: monetary donations in support of the Christmas campaign can be mailed to The Salvation Army, PO Box 199, Georgetown, ON, L7G 4YS.

Food and Gift Drives

Halton Regional Police Service - Toys for Tots
Members of the public are invited to make a donation of new, unwrapped toys for children and teens ages 10-16 years.
Where: any police station in Halton Region. The local drop off location is Halton Regional Police Service - 11 Division, 217 Guelph Street, Georgetown
When: Toys must be dropped off by Fri, Dec. 7th
Contatct: 905-825-4747 ext. 4868 (4TOT) or by emailing ToysForTots@haltonpolice.ca

Halton Regional Police Service - Holiday Food Drive
Join members of the Halton Regional Police Service as they Cram-a-Cruiser in support of The Georgetown Bread Basket * non-perishable food items such as peanut butter, jam, canned pasta, soup cans, tuna or salmon or meat cans, dry cereal, crackers and cookies, rice, juice, pudding cups, SideKicks, tea, instant coffee and baking goods are most in need
Where: Real Canadian Superstore, 171 Guelph St, Georgetown
When: Sat, Dec. 15th, 8:30 am-4 pm
Contact: www.haltonpolice.ca

Dr. Anoop Sayal & Associates Annual Food Drive
Accepting donations for the 21st annual food drive in support of the Georgetown Bread Basket.
Where: drop off donations at the office located in the Georgetown Marketplace, 280 Guelph St, Georgetown
Contact: 905-877-CARE (2273)

Leathertown Lumber Toy Drive
New, unwrapped toys and gifts for children ages birth to 14 and teenagers can be dropped off for the store's 18th annual toy drive.
Where: Leathertown Lumber, 264 Main St N, Acton
When: Donations should be dropped off by Sat, Dec. 8th
Contact: 519-853-1970

Community Dinners

Acton Community Christmas Dinner
Providing a free meal for anyone in the community looking for something to do on Christmas Day.
Where: Acton Town Hall Centre
When: Tue, Dec. 25th, 12 noon-2 pm
Contact: Register here to attend or to volunteer before or during the event
hours: Call for information

category: Children's Programs;Family Support Centres;Free / Low Cost Meals;Free / Low-cost meals;Meals for seniors / people with disabilities
desc_program:
Partners with individuals, community organizations, schools and Oakville Christian churches to minister through food drives, provision of meals, group projects and family programs:

* Monday family night - family meal * shopping for those registered * activities * guest speakers
* Tuesday, Friday - soup & refreshments
* Thursday - Community dinner
* Saturday - Community breakfast
* prenatal nutritional support
* Kids and Me
* library and literacy programs - Book Nook, summer reading program
* computer lab/instructors for children and youth of Kerr St Mission
* budgeting, debt counselling and financial literacy
* income tax preparation
* licensed after school child care program
hours:
Doors are open: Mon-Fri 9 am-8:30 pm * Sat 9 am-12 noon * Mon-Fri between 2:30 pm and 6 pm washrooms are restricted to the public because of Children & Youth programs
Summer hours: Mon, Thu 9 am-8:30 pm * Tue, Wed, Fri 9 am-5 pm * Sat 9 am-12 noon * Sun closed
* Food bank and drop-in: Tue 10:15 am-12 noon * Thu 6:30 pm-7:30 pm * Fri 10:15 am-12 noon * Sat 9:30 am-10:30 am 
* Family night: Mon 6:30 pm-7:30 pm 
* Community dinner: Thu 6:30-7:30 pm
* prenatal nutritional support: Wed 10 am-12:30 pm
* Kids and Me: Thu-9:30-11 am

* hours are subject to change, call first

desc_program:

Breakfast Program - offers free breakfast Mon, Wed and Fri 8:45 am-9:45 am * Visitors enter through the doors at the back parking area

Newborn Program - Call for information

Referral Services - Referrals to other community programs and services as appropriate

Summer Camp - for children

desc_program:
Centre provides a friendly drop in environment offering nourishment, social interaction with community members and a variety of different programs (visit website for more details on programming).

Free nutritious meals:
* weekdays - both lunch and dinner provided
* weekends - Sat lunch, Sun dinner
* all meals are grown, donated, prepared and served by the community
* everyone is welcome

Outreach Community Health Clinic:
* 360 Nurse Practitioner Led Clinic
* provides free medical care on a first come first served basis
* volunteer social workers
* available for those with or without a valid OHIP card and/or family physician

Also provides safer injection and safer smoking supplies and disposal.
hours:
Centre drop in: Mon-Sun 12 noon-7 pm * open 365 days a year including all holidays

Meals: Lunch Mon-Sat 12 noon-2 pm * Dinner Mon-Fri, Sun 5 pm-7 pm

Health Clinic: Mon 1 pm-2:30 pm (not available on holidays)

desc_program:
Operates a community centre for older adults that offers various recreational and educational programs and services

Activities and services include the following:
  • River Street Cafe
  • Registered programs such as fitness, visual arts, computer lessons, and guitar lessons
  • Drop-in activities such as card games, line dancing, and recreational sports such as badminton and pickleball
  • Income Tax Clinic (Apr and May)
  • Health and Wellness programs such as blood pressure clinic (once a month), and Hearing Screening
  • Provides space rental

desc_program:
Provides culturally appropriate and holistic long term support services and programs

Adult Day Program
  • Provides afternoons for socialization
  • Teaches various craft making sessions with focus on traditional Native crafts
  • Offers movie videos and card games

Congregate Dining
  • Provides a weekly luncheon consisting of full course meal, dessert and coffee
  • Offers craft making and time of socialization
  • Provides transportation for attendees

Friendly Visiting
  • Arranges weekly visits from support worker in individual's home
  • Provides emotional and physical support such as light housekeeping

Security Checks
  • Makes weekly calls to clients' homes to check on them and to determine pending appointments

Transportation Program
  • Provides transportation on an as needed basis to all events at the Centre, the hospital or clinic and for errands around town including grocery shopping
  • Arranges transportation for out of town specialist appointments when no other arrangements are available

Mon-Fri 9 am-5 pm
Program times vary

desc_program:
Offers the following programs and services:

Day Out program
  • Provides respite care for a spouse or caregiver for the day
  • Offers a day away program that supports socialization and learning

Home Maintenance program
  • Helps with the cost of house cleaning, snow removal and yard work
  • Offers assistance in finding a service provider to help with the work

In-home visiting
  • Provides telephone reassurance and friendly in-home visiting

Meals on Wheels
  • Offers home cooked meals delivered to the home
  • Provides an entreé, two sides, a bowl of soup and a dessert
  • Offers diabetic meal options

Potluck and Diner's Club
  • Offers a social outing and meal

Transportation program
  • Provides transportation to and from medical appointments, grocery shopping or adult day care

Exercise
  • Provides free exercise classes in Laird and Richards Landing

desc_program:
Multiple community support services offered by variety of programs

Community Development 416-252-9701 ext 240 - encouraging public participation in local planning and economic development activities

Drop-in Centre -  Mon, Wed 8:30am-2:30pm (September - June) * offers space for homeless and marginally housed individuals * nutritional meals, showers, hygiene products, harm reduction supplies, pet food, computer and phone access

Harm Reduction Services 416-252-9701 ext 287 - harm reduction supplies and information * harm reduction drop-in centre on the 2nd Thursday of each month 9:30-11:30am * free anonymous HIV test

Among Friends Program - Community mental health centre * education workshops promoting mental, physical and social health, healthy lifestyle activities and planning * information and referral * social and recreational activities

ASK! Community Information Centre - Form Filling -  access to and support with completing government forms and applications

Literacy and Basic Skills - Literacy and basic skills training, including numeracy, digital, communication and interpersonal skills * helps learners prepare for employment, apprenticeship, secondary-school credit, post-secondary education and greater independence * some financial assistance with TTC transportation available based upon eligibility

Social Work Program/Counseling Services - Social work drop-in

desc_program:
FREE / LOW COST MEALS:
* Evergreen Seniors Community Centre, 683 Woolwich St, Guelph - 519-823-1291 (ext 2696 for delivery)
- menu items are served at 8:30 am-1 pm, breakfast served from 9 am-10 am, hot lunch 11:15 am-1 pm at low cost (last order 12:40 pm)
- members may purchase a meal card for further savings
- meals ordered by 9:30 am will be delivered free to apartment buildings adjacent to the Centre (Riverside Gardens, Riverside Residences on the Park, The Driftwood and The Diplomat) ; meal card required to pay for meals delivered

* Life Centre, Royal City Church, 50 Quebec St, Guelph - 519-837-3777, thelifecentreguelph@gmail.com
- free meals available to those in need
- served Mon-Thu 7 pm, Fri 10 am-1 pm, Sat 6 pm

* Welcome In Drop In Centre, 23 Gordon St, Guelph - 519-837-0080
- meals available at low cost to individuals in need
- served Mon-Sun 11 am-2 pm

* Lakeside Hope House, 75 Norfolk St, Guelph - 519-265-4266, info@lakesidehopehouse.ca
- free, large community breakfast on Wed 10 am-11 am; daily snacks, coffee and tea (Mon-Thu)
- volunteers prepare the meal

DELIVERED MEALS: (nonprofit organization)
* Meals on Wheels - 519-323-2330 or 1-888-506-6353
- hot meal program offered by VON in Guelph, Centre Wellington, Wellington North; initial contact, administration, coordination and assessment provided by VON, Mount Forest
- frozen meal program offered in Guelph and Wellington County
- hot meal program: Mon-Fri (noon meal); frozen meals: Mon-Fri (hours vary), option of pick-up or delivery

DELIVERED MEALS: (commercial enterprises)
* Heart to Home Meals - 1-877-545-5577
- call or order online, free brochure upon request and online
- home delivery of frozen meals
- meals designed for seniors

DELIVERED MEALS: (commercial) also available for pick-up
* Portions Distinctive Meals and More - 519-837-3337
- Tue-Fri 10 am-5 pm, Sat 10 am-4 pm
- dedicated gluten free, peanut and tree nut free, allergen friendly facility
- frozen, ready to heat individual meal options
- frozen, individual ready to bake quiche, meat and fruit pies
- fresh and frozen bread, buns and deserts
- all items available to pick-up
- flat fee for delivery, call for information

MEALS PREPARED IN YOUR HOME: (commercial enterprises)

ampl_program_details: Evergreen Seniors Community Centre, 683 Woolwich St, Guelph - 519-823-1291 (ext 2696 for delivery)
- menu items are served at 8:30 am-1 pm, breakfast served from 9 am-10 am, hot lunch 11:15 am-1 pm at low cost (last order 12:40 pm)
- members may purchase a meal card for further savings

- meals ordered by 9:30 am will be delivered free to apartment buildings adjacent to the Centre (Riverside Gardens, Riverside Residences on the Park, The Driftwood and The Diplomat) ; meal card required to pay for meals delivered

- free meals available to those in need
- served Mon-Thu 7 pm, Fri 10 am-1 pm, Sat 6 pm

- meals available at low cost to individuals in need
Lakeside Hope House, 75 Norfolk St, Guelph - 519-265-4266, info@lakesidehopehouse.ca

- call or order online, free brochure upon request and online
- Tue-Fri 10 am-5 pm, Sat 10 am-4 pm

desc_program:
Community meals served at various locations in Northumberland County.

Cobourg, Lunches, (Souper-time Oct-May)
* Mon, Tue - Salvation Army hosts at St. Peter's Anglican Church, 240 College St (across from Victoria Park), 11:30 am-12:30 pm (SHA0168)
* Wed - Trinity United Church, 284 Division Street, 11:30 am-12:30 pm (SHA1188)
* Thu - St. Andrew's Presbyterian Church, 200 King St W, 11:30 am-12:30 pm (SHA0823)
* Fri - Cobourg Alliance Church hosts at St. Peter's Anglican Church, 11:30 am-12:30 pm (SHA0168)

Sandwich Program (Jun-Sep)(SHA0168)
* Mon, Wed, Fri 11:30 am-12:30 pm at Salvation Army Family Services, 66 Swayne St

Supper's Ready Brighton (Sep-Jun) - Trinity St. Andrew's United Church, 56 Prince Edward St. Brighton (NLD0099)
*Wednesday - 5 pm-6 pm. Free.

Codrington Community Centre - 2992 County Rd 30, Codrington(SHA0296)
* Tuesday - Breakfast 9 am $3/person
* Thursday - Soup-to-go 9 am-11am $2/person. Bring a one litre container for soup

Colborne Community Lunch (Sep-Jun) - Prospect House, 1 Elgin St, Colborne (NLD0075)
* Tuesday -11:30 am-1 pm. Free.

Port Hope, Lunches
* Tuesday - St. Mark's Anglican Church, 51 King St, 11:30 am-12:30 pm Free. Sep-Jun (SHA0170)
* Friday - Calvary Pentecostal Church, 401 Croft St E ( Corner of Roseglen Rd & Croft St E) - 11:30 am-1 pm (SHA0979)
Port Hope, Dinners
* Wednesday - Green Wood Coalition hosts at Church of St. John the Evangelist, 33 Pine St N, Refreshments: 5 pm, Dinner: 6 pm-7 pm. Free (NLD0047)

Warkworth Community Lunch
* FREE monthly lunch with coffee and tea at 11 am and lunch at 12 noon. * Monday - Jan 7, 2019, Feb 4, Mar 4, Apr 1, May 6, Jun 3 - St. Paul's United Church, The Gathering Place, 60 Main St, Warkworth. Warkworthabundance.ca (no lunch Jul and Aug)
Warkworth Community Dinner
* Sunday - Every 2 months - Warkworth Free Methodist Church, 56 Mill St., 5 pm-6:30 pm * Apr 14, 2019 * Lift available. Call 705-924-2935 for information. No Charge.

Campbellford Community Lunches
* 1st Sunday of the month - St John's United Church, 50 Bridge St W at 12:30 pm. No Charge (SHA0096)

Hastings Community Lunch
* Second Fri of the month - Hastings Civic Centre, 6 Albert St E. at 12 noon. No Charge

St James Anglican, 6 Hamilton St, Stratford - Dec 25th only at 12 noon (PER2539)

Jubilee Christian Fellowship - 707 Downie Street, Stratford - Tues Feb 13 @ 5:15
